page.title: 13DAWLINGS FARM
page.content: Dawlings farm is a fruit farm, the land around it is flat and of medium loam, the farm is 46 acres. Most of the work on the farm is done by hand, there are only two tractors, a large and a small tractor. The farmer employs a larger number of labourers in the summer than in the winter. There is no method of crop rotation, once the plants are planted they remain in. Spraying is done at the end of spring and again before the crops are picked, this is done by the small tractor. Work is from 5 am till dark. The farm used to be under contract, and although this gave no problems, he prefers free lance or Pick Your Own. He grows strawberries, raspberries,gooseberries,red and blackcurrents,and loganberries. He also grows some barley.
